About me how i fell in love with tutoring

My love for it began while studying maths at The University of East Anglia. While there, I worked with a charity to help children from underprivileged backgrounds improve their maths and English.

Watching the growth of these children was incredible and inspired me to pursue this as my job.

I knew if I wanted to make the most impact on a student, it would be in a one-to-one setting. That's because I can change my style to fit the student's needs.

To make the most impact on a student, it would be in a 1-to-1 lesson. I can change my style to fit the student's needs.

And for the last 7 years, I have done that. I've helped students go from grade 3 to grade 7 in their GCSEs.

I have helped A-Level students with their entrance exams to Oxford or Cambridge.

I'm extraordinarily proud of each of my students and go to the best of my ability to give them the support they're seeking.

Please send a message here for more information.

YouTube Olympiad maths problems

The Olympiad is a maths event for children in primary and secondary school. Winning can help you get into the best universities like Cambridge and Oxford.

You can also be head-hunted at companies like Jane Street, Two Sigma Investments, or Quora.

Olympiad problems go much further than regular school questions. They make you understand topics more deeply.

I use these problems to help my GCSE students go from grade 7/8 to grade 9.

Check out my channel for more examples of these problems.
